title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Moderna to complete US mRNA manufacturing network
items.summary:
- Moderna will operate full *end-to-end* mRNA drug product manufacturing in the US, onshoring production at its *Norwood, Massachusetts* campus.
- The company is investing over *$140 million* to add the final *fill-finish* step, supporting commercial and clinical supply and creating hundreds of *biomanufacturing jobs*.
- This move reduces *reliance on contract manufacturers*, strengthens *domestic supply chains*, and could shape long-term *US biopharma strategies*.

items.title: Railways, ROQIT launch AI parcel platform
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- The project starts with a pilot on South Central Railway in early 2026, expanding later nationwide, to replace paper processes with predictive scheduling, instant booking, digital payments and *real-time tracking*.
- ROQIT will provide a cloud-native app for door-to-door parcel services, a marketplace to choose partners, and an electric-mobility backbone via *ETO Motors* for green, *zero-emission* movement.
- Indian Railways aims to grow small-parcel traffic, improve reliability, and support a near-100% green transport capability aligned with the *Net-Zero vision*.

items.title: Servotech wins ₹73.7 Cr rooftop solar project
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - *Servotech Renewable Power System* won a ₹73.7 crore grid-connected rooftop solar project under the **PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana**, marking a milestone in distributed-energy deployment.\n- The project will deploy rooftop systems across **Kavali division** and will serve 5,886 *SC/ST households*, with Servotech handling design, engineering, supply, installation, testing and commissioning plus five years of O&M.\n- It uses a utility-led aggregation model to boost access to *grid-connected solar power* for underserved communities, aligning with India's clean-energy goals.
keywords: PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana

items.title: L&T, BAE Systems bags defence contract for BvS10 vehicles from Indian Army
Adani-Bondada tie-up for renewable energy design and build
items.summary:
- *Bondada Engineering* signed a five-year framework with *Adani Group* to establish a long-term strategic design and construction partnership in the *renewable energy* sector.
- The first tranche awards *Bondada* 650 MW of solar construction from *Adani Green Energy*, with the signing in Ahmedabad on Nov 18 by Vineet Jain and Bondada Raghavendra Rao.
- *Bondada* will be a strategic partner for the 30 GW Khavda renewables park in Gujarat; the firm has 1 GW commissioned and 1.8 GW under execution.

items.title: Concord subsidiary wins ₹19.17 cr Indian Railways order
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- **Advanced Rail Controls**, the wholly‑owned subsidiary of *Concord Control Systems*, has won a ₹19.17 crore order from **Indian Railways** for a **loco wireless control system**. 
- The contract covers supply, installation and commissioning and will be executed in seven months, with end‑to‑end delivery and no related‑party interests. 
- This win reinforces *Concord Control Systems*'s footprint in **railway control technology** and aligns with IR's safety and efficiency goals.

items.title: Calderys debuts basic monolithics in Odisha facility
items.summary: - *Calderys* has commissioned its *basic monolithics* production line at a new facility in *Odisha*, as part of the CAPES project to expand in India.\n- The CAPES plant, spanning 45 acres, will host six lines for *acidic and basic monolithics and bricks*, with full-scale production expected in the second half of 2026.\n- The move aims to boost sectors like steel, cement, aluminium, petrochemicals and mining, support exports in APAC, and advance India’s *Make in India* and *Atmanirbhar Bharat* goals.

items.title: NTPC Green 75.5 MW at Khavda-I, Gujarat
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - NTPC Green Energy (**NGEL**) commissioned 75.5 MW at *Khavda-I solar project* in *Gujarat* and declared it commercially operational on Nov 19, 2025. - With this expansion, **NGEL**'s commercial capacity rises to 7,563 MW, and total installed capacity reaches 7,639 MW. - The project is under the CPSU Scheme Phase-II, Tranche-III by **NTPC Renewable Energy**, reinforcing the nation's move toward *renewable energy*.

items.title: Inox Green to manage O&M for 5-GW wind–solar projects of INOXGFL, KP Group
Goyal to visit Israel for trade, tech and investment talks
items.summary: - Commerce and Industry Minister *Piyush Goyal* will visit *Israel* with a 60-member delegation to advance bilateral cooperation in *trade*, *technology* and *investment*.\n- He will participate in the *India–Israel Business Forum*, and the fourth *CEOs Forum* to discuss partnerships and investments.\n- The talks will cover collaboration in *agriculture*, water, defence, emerging technologies, life sciences, infrastructure and the proposed *India–Israel Free Trade Agreement*.

items.title: Azad Eng shares rise after Pratt & Whitney pact
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - Azad Engineering shares rose about 2% after signing a strategic pact with **Pratt & Whitney Canada Corporation** to collaborate on developing and manufacturing *aircraft engine components*.\n- The framework aims to bolster Azad's aerospace capabilities and strengthen its order book, supplementing a prior ₹651 crore deal with Mitsubishi Heavy Industries that lifts total MHI value to ₹1,387 crore.\n- In Q2 FY26, Azad reported net profit ₹33 crore on revenue ₹145.6 crore, with EBITDA ₹53.2 crore and margins at 36.5%.

items.title: Inox Solar & KPI to develop 2.5 GW solar across India
items.summary:
- *Inox Solar* and *KPI Green Energy* signed an exclusive *Memorandum of Understanding (MoU)* to develop **2.5 GW** of *solar and hybrid renewable-energy* projects across multiple states, with Inox supplying modules and overseeing *pre-commissioning*, *commissioning*, and *O&M* for the modules.
- KPI will handle project development, including *land acquisition*, *connectivity*, *statutory approvals*, and execution of balance-of-plant and *EPC* works.
- The partnership fuses **manufacturing and engineering capabilities** with *KPI’s development expertise* to drive faster, large-scale *clean energy deployment* across India.

items.title: MeitY aims $150B via components
items.summary: - *S Krishnan* says the goal is to achieve about $150B through *component manufacturing* and exports as part of a $500B electronics target.\n- The scheme, **ECMS**, aims to deepen India’s value chain and make electronics manufacturing globally competitive, not tariff-driven.\n- 17 **ECMS** projects worth ₹7,172 crore were approved, bringing total to 24 across nine states.

items.title: Textiles PLI: 17 new applicants approved
items.summary:
- The Ministry has approved *17 new applicants* under the PLI for Textiles in Round 3.
- These projects involve an investment of **₹2,374 crore** and are expected to generate sales of **₹12,893 crore** while employing about **22,646 people**.
- The PLI scheme targets *MMF apparel*, *MMF fabrics*, and *Technical Textiles* to boost domestic manufacturing and global competitiveness, with the online portal reopened till **31 December 2025**.

items.title: Uttar Pradesh frames energy roadmap to become green leader by 2047
Steel minister opens SAIL Rourkela facility
items.summary: - Union minister *H D Kumaraswamy* inaugurated a modern *steel-making facility* at SAIL's Rourkela Steel Plant and launched the *Caster-4 unit*.\n- Plans to more than double capacity to around *9 MTPA* with about *Rs 30,000 crore* investment.\n- Expansion aims to boost supplies to defence, oil and gas, and automobiles with sustained government support.

items.title: Taiwan energy strain prompts shift of chip ops to US
items.author: ANI
items.summary:
- Pat Gelsinger warned Taiwan's *energy strain* undermines a resilient *energy supply chain* and calls for shifting part of the global semiconductor production base to the **United States**.
- He stressed that Taiwan's manufacturing strengths are offset by *energy-related risks* that threaten long-term *supply-chain stability*, even as **TSMC** expands in the US.
- Gelsinger urged Taiwanese chipmakers to diversify geographically, increase advanced nodes and **R&D** in the **U.S.**, viewing it as a growth hub for future capacity.

items.title: Singer to manufacture auto zig zag sewing machines in India
items.summary:
- Singer India plans *local manufacturing* of **Auto Zig Zag** sewing machines after a licensing deal with SVP Worldwide.
- The machines will carry **BIS certification** to meet government quality and safety standards in India.
- The initiative could boost exports and improve cost competitiveness for India in global markets.

items.title: Goyal calls for analysis of services trade data
items.summary:
- **Piyush Goyal** called for analysis of *services sector trade data* to help stakeholders tap global opportunities.
- The government launched the Trade Intelligence and Analytics (TIA) Portal, a one-stop platform with over 270 analytics for real-time insights.
- He urged greater use of **Free Trade Agreements** and more transparent trade data for exporters, importers, startups, and MSMEs.

items.title: Russia offers India shipbuilding collaboration
items.author: Dipanjan Roy Chaudhury, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Russia offered India shipbuilding collaboration, including providing existing or developing new designs for *fishing*, *passenger* and *auxiliary vessels*, and highlighted expertise in *ice-class ships*, *icebreakers*, and **green shipbuilding**.
- In talks between Nikolai Patrushev and Sarbananda Sonowal, both sides discussed civilian maritime cooperation in *shipbuilding*, *port infrastructure* and *maritime logistics*.
- PM Modi and Patrushev met to discuss maritime cooperation, connectivity, skill development and the **blue economy**, with India seeking to build vessels and tankers to safeguard against sanctions.

items.title: Apple India: Profit up 16%, Revenue ₹79,378 cr
items.author: PTI
items.summary: - *Apple India* posted a 16% rise in profit to *₹3,196 crore* for FY25, up from ₹2,745.71 crore.\n- Revenue climbed 18% to *₹79,378 crore* in FY25, with expenses around *₹75,191 crore* as per filings via Tofler.\n- Employee benefits rose about *19.5%* to *₹3,107.35 crore*, reflecting broader cost growth.

items.title: Handset makers dial down imports of components after festive surge
Xiaomi warns of higher prices due to memory-chip costs
items.author: Che Pan, Brenda Goh
items.summary:
- Xiaomi warned that consumers are likely to see higher smartphone prices next year due to surging **memory chips** costs.
- Lu Weibing said price increases alone won't digest all costs, and some pressure may be addressed through **price hikes**.
- In Q3, Xiaomi shipped **43.3 million handsets** and grew revenue, with EV and AI initiatives helping profits.

items.title: Nvidia, Microsoft invest $15B in Anthropic
items.author: Alex Pigman
items.summary:
- Nvidia and Microsoft pledge a combined $15B to **Anthropic** (Claude), with Nvidia up to $10B and Microsoft up to $5B.
- Anthropic will buy about $30B of Microsoft **Azure** cloud capacity and adopt Nvidia’s GPUs, with a joint go-to-market plan for AI.
- The move signals a major realignment in generative AI among rivals like **OpenAI** and Google’s **Gemini**, with Anthropic valued around $350B.

items.title: India's semiconductor push needs full-ecosystem support
items.summary:
- *Chachra* says India's semiconductor vision is a great strategy, but its success depends on quickly enabling a broader *ecosystem* with less *red tape* and stronger industry coordination.
- To translate this into sustained growth, India must build a collaborative *ecosystem* across the value chain rather than rely on isolated capabilities, allowing all players to participate and innovate.
- The country can chart its own model by leveraging open *public digital infrastructure* (like UPI) and moving toward *AI-native infrastructure* and stronger *India-US technology cooperation* to turn digital rails into practical, scalable solutions.

items.title: Space sector to become ‘important contributor' to India’s economy, says MoS Jitendra Singh
Andhra Pradesh to host India’s first giga-scale electric air taxi manufacturing cluster
Skipper partners with Lubrizol for CPVC technology integration
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Skipper Limited partners with *Lubrizol* to integrate Temprite *CPVC technology* into its piping products, enabling heat and pressure resistance as well as *corrosion and microbial shielding*. 
- Lubrizol says Temprite material has been used globally in plumbing for more than 60 years, aligning with safety and reliability for Indian systems. 
- The collaboration strengthens Skipper’s CPVC portfolio, offering *lead-free water flow* with potentially lower maintenance costs.

items.title: Minister urges freighters as India eyes air cargo growth
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Union minister *K. Rammohan Naidu* urged Indian carriers to add **freighters** and build *cargo-centric airports* to tap air cargo opportunities.
- He pointed out India has 17 freighters vs the US’s 200+ and stressed the commercial viability of dedicated freighters.
- At the Global Aviation & Air Cargo Conclave 2025, he targets 10 mt by 2030, 21 by 2047, and a 6-hour reduction in processing time.

items.title: Etihad Airways orders 32 new Airbus widebody aircraft in major fleet expansion
Tata Projects, ASI sign MoU to provide services for design, construction of aircraft maintenance facilities
Stellantis’ Hosur plant emerges as a global powertrain hub, gears up for hydrogen tech
Monolithisch India completes MIGPL acquisition
items.summary: - Monolithisch India completed the MIGPL acquisition, making it a **wholly owned subsidiary** after Nov 8 shareholder approval.\n- MIGPL integration lifts capacity to 2,63,600 tpa; revenue ₹49.39 crore and PAT ₹6.30 crore in the previous year.\n- MD Harsh Tekriwal says the deal strengthens the *ramming mass* business and should boost manufacturing, efficiency, and supply-chain synergies.

items.title: Trishakti Industries wins work order from Reliance Industries
Glenmark, Cosmo Pharmaceuticals get marketing authorisation for Winlevi in Europe
PVV Infra to build 1 GW TOPCon plant in Andhra Pradesh
items.summary:
- PVV Infra signed a **₹650 crore** MoU with the Andhra Pradesh Economic Development Board to set up a **1 GW TOPCon solar cell manufacturing facility** in Visakhapatnam.
- The 30-acre site near the airport project is expected to create about 350 direct jobs and over 450 indirect jobs, per the press release.
- The project supports India’s renewable infrastructure goals and aims to boost domestic solar cell production in Andhra Pradesh.

items.title: Musashi India expands Bengaluru plant for EV components
items.summary:
- Musashi India completed the second phase of its Bengaluru plant expansion, aiming for full operation by *December 2025*.
- The upgrade adds forging, machining and heat‑treatment to support 100–750cc bikes, 100–125cc scooters and *e-axles*, lifting annual scooter/motorcycle transmissions to *6.5 million* sets.
- The facility spans 32,000 sq m, with rooftop solar (2.16 million kWh) and over *96% green energy*, reinforcing its commitment to a sustainable *EV supply chain*.

items.title: Goods exports down 11.8% in October, trade deficit widens on gold imports
RITES, AP to sign MoU for infra and industrial development
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- *RITES* signs a MoU with the *APEDB* to provide consultancy for *infrastructure* and *industrial development* in the state.
- The pact covers *feasibility studies*, *DPRs*, *project management consultancy*, *bid management* and *third-party inspection* across transport, ports, waterways, power, water and wastewater, buildings and industrial infra.
- *RITES* aims to facilitate investments and support *planning* and *execution* of projects across key sectors in Andhra Pradesh.

items.title: Pricol to invest up to ₹600 crore as it enters fresh capex cycle
Nuvoco Vistas to acquire Algebra Endeavour for ₹200 crore
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Nuvoco Vistas Corporation* signed a Securities Purchase Agreement to acquire 100% of Algebra Endeavour Private, the holding company of *Vadraj Energy*, to bolster captive power for cement operations.  
- The deal involves a cash consideration of up to ₹200 crore, including ₹191.63 crore to *JSW Cement* and ₹8.36 crore to *Alpha Alternatives*, with the closing subject to regulatory approvals.  
- Upon completion, Algebra will become a wholly owned subsidiary of Nuvoco and a related party under SEBI regulations.

items.title: Apple sales growth in India at 6-year low of 18%
Stellantis sets ₹10,000 crore India component export goal for 2026
items.author: Alenjith K Johny, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Stellantis aims to export about **₹10,000 crore** in India‑sourced components by 2026 via its suppliers, up from about ₹4,000 crore today.
- The Hosur plant exports **95%** of its output, with capacity for **300,000 engines** and **374,000 gearboxes**.
- India is the third‑largest auto market with **4.2 million** sales in 2024, accounting for ~**2%** of Stellantis’ global volume, with **₹11,000 crore** invested in India across three plants.

items.title: India's air cargo sector thrives in a world of tariffs
Sarla Aviation to build world’s largest eVTOL ‘Sky Factory’ in Andhra Pradesh
MeitY eyes to achieve $150 billion through components manufacturing: S Krishnan
Vaishnaw: Design capabilities to guide ECMS approvals
items.summary:
- Vaishnaw urged firms to build local *design capabilities* and make them a criterion for **ECMS** approvals.
- He called building design teams a *non-negotiable* part of the electronics manufacturing journey.
- The ECMS expansion aims to boost investments, create jobs, and stress *quality*, *self-reliance*, and the vision of *Viksit Bharat*.

items.title: Maharashtra becomes first state to join Centre’s nuclear power initiative
Exide targets lithium-ion cell production by FY26-end, in talks with top two-wheeler OEMs
How DLI scheme is helping India build its own semiconductor IP
